alert.note: Alert for Hoke; Richmond; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 7:17PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Hoke, Richmond and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laurinburg, Rockingham, Raeford, Hamlet, Antioch, Dobbins Heights, Wagram, Gibson, East Laurinburg, Laurel Hill, Bowmore, Silver City, East Rockingham, Diggs and Rockfish. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Rockfish Rd at Gully Branch and Richmond Mill Lake Dam. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
